hashtag#Hiring hashtag#UAEJob Location: UAEWe are seeking a highly skilled DevOps Engineer with strong Kubernetes expertise to join our dynamic team. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing containerized environments, automating deployment pipelines, and improving system reliabilityand scalability. You will work closely with software development, IT operations, and other teams to ensure smooth and efficient software delivery.Responsibilities:Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the software development lifecycle (SDLC) from build through deployment and monitoring.Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters, ensuring scalability, high availability and performance.Collaborate with development teams to integrate deployment automation and monitoring into the development process.Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure, deployment, and operational issues in containerized environments.Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform or Ansible.Continuously improve monitoring, alerting, and logging processes to ensure proactive identification of system issues.Perform system upgrades, security patches, and routine maintenance to ensure a stable environment.Develop and maintain automated testing and deployment scripts to streamline the software release process.Contribute to the development and enforcement of best practices for security, compliance, and performance in development and production environments.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve development workflows, release processes, and system scalability.Requirements:At least 5 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer with a strong focus on Kubernetes.Hands-on experience in managing and deploying Kubernetes clusters, both on-premise and in cloud environments.Strong knowledge of containerization technologies, including Docker and Kubernetes orchestration.Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.Proficiency in scripting and programming languages such as Python, Bash, or Go.Solid understanding of configuration management tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.Experience with monitoring tools and systems (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack).Ability to troubleshoot issues across the stack (networking, security, application, databases).Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with development, QA, and operations teams.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.Kubernetes certification (e.g., Certified Kubernetes Administrator, Certified Kubernetes Application Developer).Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaC) practices and tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.Experience in automating deployment and configuration management for microservices architectures.Please send updated profile to basil@acis.io

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps

Report: Tech Worker Retirements Put Government Agencies on Edge!The Australian Public Service faces a critical challenge as over 20% of its ICT and Digital Solutions workforce approaches retirement age. With retirement separations expected to exceed 5,200 by 2029 and legacy systems requiring 800+ staff to maintain, we're witnessing a perfect storm of talent drain and technical debt.This highlights a broader issue in our approach to technical education. The traditional education system, designed around a factory mentality from 100 years ago, is failing to meet today's rapidly evolving tech needs.At Cipher Projects we're addressing DevOps skills gaps by connecting global talent with organizations facing these challenges. But the long-term solution requires fundamentally rethinking tech education - implementing AI-enhanced, individualized learning paths focused on practical skills without the unnecessary debt and time investment of traditional degrees.The reality is clear: hiring managers value on-the-job experience and personal projects over degrees. While certifications help bridge the gap, they often lack sufficient hands-on building and labs components.As government agencies struggle with this transition, organizations that embrace new approaches to technical training and talent acquisition will have a significant competitive advantage.What's your experience with technical skill gaps in your organization?hashtag#TechTalent hashtag#SkillsGap hashtag#DevOps
